newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds slip, market seen subdued.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds slip, market seen subdued.

text.p: Argentine bonds were slightly softer Tuesday in late morning trade amid sluggish activity.
"The market is slow, waiting and correcting slightly," said a trader at a large foreign bank.
The dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 slipped $0.10 to 120.55, while Argentina's FRB due 2005 was flat at 84-7/8.

Traders said after the sharp gains last week the market has slowed down with expectations of a correction before a resumption in the upward trend. But for now, "the reality is we are not expecting anything," said another trader.
Market players say the hot issue continues to be the spread between peso and dollar bonds. "Players are continuing to discuss the spread," said the first trader.
The market is split on whether the spread will continue to narrow or not.
Some analysts argue the declining spread can still go further, thus reducing even more the devaluation risk of the peso, while others say profit-taking could set in.
